Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is six a.m. [DeAngelo yawns] and we are about to go house to house to give everyone their Dundie Nomination Certificates. Just like the Oscars!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Yes, and this happens every...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Every year! This happens, you have a lot to learn my friend. [DeAngelo laughs]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Well, you know, why don't we try it, and if it goes good it'll be part of my tradition.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you always say that? You're gonna love it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [arriving at the first house] Alright let's go! [DeAngelo runs in the wrong direction] This way, this way! [Michael knocks on the door]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Surprise!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Congratulations!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and Pam have both been nominated for Dundie Awards!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holds up a camera and DeAngelo meows] Here we go! Have Pam come down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No she doesn't wa- She's not here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stay in bed!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [next house] Congratulations!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Have you lost your mind! Get off my property before I call the police!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We got it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Uh, leave it at the door or...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah that's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [next house] Hey Toby! You suck! [throwing eggs at his house]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Is this an employee of ours?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [giggles] Go go go go go go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [arriving at a dumpy looking, unkempt house] I've never seen this place in the daylight.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: It reminds me of Katrina.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go, alright got it? Set? [the door is ajar, Michael knocks lightly] Hello? [turns around to see Meredith walking towards her house]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm so busted! Walk of shame!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Do you usually leave your door unlocked? And ajar?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ahh, Nice! I got a Dundie nomination!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you did. That's right! Congratulations Meredith. We should head out.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No no no! You guys stay! No no no! I have Vienna Sausages and I have napkins. [walks into her house] Let me fix you breakfast!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [whispers] I'm not going in there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [quietly shuts the door] Go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking into the office] Good morning Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh hey, didn't see you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have big plans for tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know, maybe volunteer at the shelter, or go to bed, or... I don't know. Maybe I'm going to the Dundies!! [Flashes her Nomination Certificate]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are getting so funny! [Erin giggles] Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The Dundies are my baby, and they need to go on. When Larry King died they didn't just cancel his show. They got Pierce Morgan to come in, and do his show, and, that way, Larry lives on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anything can happen at the Dundies! [DeAngelo laughs] They're like the Golden Globes but less mean. And I just want all of us to have a good time!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just a little announcement folks, remember, the Dundies is a black tie affair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Black tie optional.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every day is black tie optional!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A la, tonight we will be hosting at Louie Volpies!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice! [rest of the office looks excited]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I love their breadsticks!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, their breadsticks are like crack!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I love when people say like crack when they've obviously never done crack.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well the breadsticks are like what then, Ryan, what can I use?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know, something from your world. The breadsticks are like scrapbooking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're right, you're right. I'm a middle class broad. [Jim does his "Jim face"]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh, shh! Okay, okay. Everybody's right. They're like breadsticks on steroids. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah that's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So as you know, the Dundies are my legacy. So I'm going to need to train a replacement. So this year, I have decided to have a co-host. [Dwight looks suspecting] And that person is [he and DeAngelo roll their tongues as a drum roll] DeAngelo! [all applaud]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Always the padawan, never the Jedi.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael, uh, but I will have to pass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Think of it as part of your training.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Not much of a performer, unless you count singing in the shower. Boy, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [smiling] Okay, well we'll work on it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [whispers to Michael] Michael, I'm very, very bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [all in conference room] Guys! I want you to help us work on some banter.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! I love banter. But I hate witty banter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go! So, DeAngelo! You and I have a lot in common. You lost two hundred pounds, and I lose my car keys every morning.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: That is true, we do share some similarities. I know how you can fix one of those problems, for me it was portion control. For you, you need a key chain. Maybe one with a-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [cutting him off] Okay, okay. You know what, I didn't actually lose my keys...

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: This did not happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmmkay. There needs to be what you call a rat-a-tat. And right now it's all rat and no tat. Ryan come on up here. Tap DeAngelo out. Just watch this. Okay. [Ryan stands next to Michael up front] Ryan how are you today?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why don't you ask my therapist, my mom certainly pays her enough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [very excited] There you go! Lovely! Regis and Kelly! Nice! Use that as an inspiration. Just be funny.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Uhhh, you sir! [points to Jim] Are we having fun tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Having a great time.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Oh good!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Where were you on September 11th?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! God! [Jim looks at him oddly]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: This is so weird! If I'm conducting a meeting, good to go. But if I think of it as a performance... I-I fall apart. Obviously.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why don't you think of hosting the Dundies like you're just running a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no! This is the performance of your life!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't you just, privately, in your own head, think of it like a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, please no loopholes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, why do you have to control how he perceives it in his mind?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is my last Dundies ever, if I want mind control over him, is that too much to ask?

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [laying down, Michael is sitting on DeAngelo's stomach bouncing up and down in Michael's office] Me mo. Me mo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Good. Good!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Meee Mo, Mee!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now, tell me something terrible that happened in your childhood.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: When I was very young, my mother divorced my father and I had to go to court and choose between them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [getting off his stomach] Too personal. I don't wanna hear about it. [picking up a portable tape player] Let's try this. Put these on. [DeAngelo puts the headphones in] I am going to turn this on, and turn the volume all the way up. So you can't- [DeAngelo winces] That's right, you're not going to be able to hear yourself. Read this, [gives him a card] and make it sound perfect.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: THE DUNDIES ARE-OW-ABOUT COMING TOGETHER! AND RECOGNIZING, THE ADOMINABILITY OF THE HUMAN SPIRIT! [Jim comes and closes the door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Say it with an accent!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [bad Australian accent attempt] THE DUNDIES!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [also in a poor Australian accent] The Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: THE DUNDIES!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Pam are walking outside] I just don't understand the desire to push sweet potato fries on me, and not just regular fries.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah... [they see Erin eating in her car, and ducking when they see her. Pam knocks on her car window] Hey, Erin, everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Get away from the car, he's gonna see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who's gonna see us?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [desperately] Just get in! Get in! Just get in!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Get in the car? [Jim and Pam get in the back seat]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Please! Sorry. Get in. [Jim and Pam are confused and worried] Sorry sorry sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I eat lunch in the car now. It's my alone time. It's just nice to have some time away from Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why don't you wanna eat lunch with your boyfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I, really don't like spending time with him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't you think it's better to tell him the truth now? You know, rather than waste more of his time?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I'm gonna go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you got this. Kay? [Erin nods] Alright. Feel better!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, that just wasn't interesting to me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I can't just dump him Pam, I'm not like you, I can't be mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, when am I...? You just have to be clear and firm. You know, just tell him you don't love him. Just be honest with him. [Erin nods]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [standing by the Louie Volpies entrance greeting people and giving them menus]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [walks in] Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Appalling. [Meredith walks in] Eye sore. [Jim and Pam come in] Surprisingly adequate! Okay everyone! The activities commence in four seconds!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: DeAngelo, Jo's on the phone for you.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: "Jo"
Quote.Text: [Michael dressed as Jo Bennett, using a bad Southern accent] DeAngelo! We're in serious horse manure here! The Dundies are tonight! And we ain't got no host!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Oh no!

Quote.Speaker: "Jo"
Quote.Text: Luckily I have someone for you!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Billy Crystal?

Quote.Speaker: "Jo"
Quote.Text: Better.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Neil Patrick Harris?

Quote.Speaker: "Jo"
Quote.Text: He's in Little Shop of Horrors on Broadway. Now we need Michael Scott! The best darn Dundies host on both sides of the Mississippi! [everyone in the audience is laughing]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Ughhh, I gotta find Michael Scott! And then I gotta, [Russel Brand impression] Get Him to the Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [in the office near the accountants] Hey, can you help me find Michael Scott Angela?

Quote.Speaker: "Angela"
Quote.Text: [Michael is wearing a blond wig, talking in a high obnoxious voice] My boyfriend can, he's a state senator.

Quote.Speaker: Audience
Quote.Text: [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh wait, he can't help because that title has no meaning!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Try Jim DeAngelo, he'll be able to help.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Jim! Do you know where I can find Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: "Jim"
Quote.Text: [Michael is wearing a wig that is very close to Jim's actual hair, and he is wearing fake earrings, and speaking in a punk-ish deep voice] I totally don't know where Michael is, dude, hey you wanna listen to some records?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shaking head at the camera]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: No one is listening to me! And I'm running out of time!

Quote.Speaker: "Phyllis"
Quote.Text: [Micheal dressed as Phyllis, pretending to knit] Well, what are you talking about? [cracking noise] Ohh! Ohh! [falls onto the ground] I've fallen and I can't get up!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Maybe I just need to look into my heart. [in the bathroom in front of the mirror] DeAngelo, where is Michael Scott. [his reflection in the mirror turns around to reveal that it is Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm here. [DeAngelo gasps and turns around] In a good way! I've been here the whole time.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The analytical part of me wants to examine it, but I know it has no content.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, please stand up for you co-host this evening, Michael Gary Scott. [Michael comes running up to stage as people applaud] Please remain standing for your other co-host, and new manager, DeAngelo Jeremitrius Vickers! [DeAngelo presents himself, and changes his mind and runs off] Was that part of the...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the bathroom] DeAngelo, what are you doing? There's a live audience out there!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Go do it by yourself, get Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Ryan would never do it. It's too on the radar. Look, look. The boss, hosts, the Dundies! It's sort of our perk!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: This was not, part of the job description!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen to me, you're not doing this for me, you're not doing this for you, you're not even doing this for them!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Who am I doing this for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [slaps him] You're doing this for all those kids out there, eating off the Louie Volpies kid's menu, wondering: Does it get better? What I want you to do, is I want you to say: It's showtime. Get out there.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I can't. [Michael slaps him again]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Say it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Stop, hitting me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can do it, just say it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Hit me again. [Michael slaps him once more]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now hit me. [DeAngelo slaps him] One, two, three.

Quote.Speaker: Together
Quote.Text: It's showtime.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Okay! Sorry about the delay everybody! But we were at the DMV waiting in line. [everyone laughs]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Fall asleep right after sex. Huh guys?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, go back to the script.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are a lot of great salesmen in this office, but one of our great salesmen is also a great dad. And a close personal friend of mine, Jim Halpert! Best Dad Dundie! [Dwight plays a celebratory honking noise on his keyboard]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! I do not parent for the award but I gotta tell you It feels pretty good. Uh, Cece, if you're watching this at home it's way past your bedtime, by the way how'd this get televised?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know maybe being a good dad is just all in your own compass. I don't know, I don't know. Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. [all applaud Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You didn't think to mention me huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Didn't I?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Which moves us to, Best Mom Dundie. [Pam gets ready and Jim smiles at her] I guess we all kinda consider her a mom around the office. Meredith Palmer!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [jogs up and makes out with Michael, who is unwilling] Tell ya one thing, I'm not gonna be a good mom tonight! Whooo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, can I get a photo of the Best Mom and the Best Dad please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I gotta go do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [annoyed] Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Big smiles folks! There they are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Year after year, I catch a lot of flak on this particular award, because year after year I present this award to a guy instead of a girl. Hottest in the office goes to, [Ryan stands up] Danny Cordray! [Ryan quickly sits] Danny couldn't be here tonight...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How do I feel about not winning Hottest in the Office this year? Uhm, I'm very relieved. How do you, how do you judge something like that? What is the criteria even? It's, it's so subjective.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley Hudson is a grump, everybody knows that. [Stanley looks angry] But did you know, that Stanley Hudson is also the face of a debilitating disease known as diabetes. The Diabetes Award goes to Stanley Hudson! [Stanley slowly walks over, angry] Come on up here you sick bastard.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have diabetes too. You don't see me making a big deal about it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: They say he's going to be my right hand man, adlib masturbation joke. [realizing he wasn't supposed to read that directly off the cue card, speaks quietly] No, I hate this, I hate it so much. [loud again] Dwight Schrute! Please accept this promising Assistant Manager Dundie. [people clap as Dwight takes the microphone, he is obviously unenthused] Thank you, thank you so much. I would like to thank something that we, uh, take for granted in our daily lives. And that is the humble trashcan. [Creed nods] This is for you trashcan! [walks off and throws the Dundie into the trashcan]

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: [the manager of Louie Volpies approaches a giggling Kevin, who is coloring with crayons on the tablecloth] Who gave you those crayons?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I brought them from home! Do you have a red?

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: This is a cloth tablecloth! You can't color on it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh really? [camera shows that Kevin has drawn a house on the tablecloth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, herpes affects one in five sexually active adults? [manager looks up, angrily at Michael] Pippy Longstocking, Ronald McDonald's wife, Ron Howard, Ron Weasley, what do thay all have in common? Red heads. Erin Hannon, come on up here and receive your Cutest Red Head in the Office Award! [Erin looks thrilled and walks up to the stage]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That is bull! [throws her Dundie]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you, thank you! This is the first award I've ever won in my entire life. [Gabe and Andy smile at her] People are right about the Dundies, they are magical. But, I don't feel it. And I think that's because I'm not with the right person. Gabe, we should break up.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm not attracted to you. I just, I cringe when you talk. I have to be honest. Right, right Pam? [Pam looks very awkward] Thank you for hearing me.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [stands up and walks to stage, takes the microphone] Well, this is embarrassing, um, I'm obviously really angry at Erin. It's that quarter life crisis everyone's been talking about. [Jim is looking wide eyed, jaw dropped] Alright I'm gonna go. [Dwight plays cricket noises]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [escorts Erin off stage] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Damn that was cold.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is difficult to recognize the person who will be replacing you. But he is a good guy, so the Michael Scott Award for Best Dundies Host goes to DeAngelo Vickers. [DeAngelo jogs up and takes the Dundie and tries to go back to his seat]

Quote.Speaker: Audience
Quote.Text: Speech! Speech! Speech! Speech!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Hold on, hold on one second. [puts on the headphones and turns the volume up all the way] I WANNA, I WANNA, I FEEL TRULY BLESSED! UHHH, TO BE WORKING WITH ALL OF YOU! BEFORE THIS ALL STARTED, FUNNY STORY, I WAS IN THE BATHROOM, VOMITTING, AND VOMITTING IN THE MEN'S ROOM!

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. [trying to stop him from offending other people in his restaurant]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: THAT'S WHY IT'S BEEN SHUT DOWN FOR MOST OF THE EVENING...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stopping Manager] DeAngelo is expressing himself. [manager pulls the microphone cable, everyone can still here DeAngelo.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: This is truly special, for me! And uh, anyway. It's so much lighter!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, we're done! That's it.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Michael, are we?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're done. We're done!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Outside of the restaurant, obviously sad] So that is how it ends. My last Dundies ever. I was hoping it'd be more like Godfather Three. That rapped up the whole franchise in an extremely satisfying way. But instead it is like Godfather One! That was, very confusing, had maybe three big laughs. Oh well...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, we were thinking maybe we could keep this thing going!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I know I'm the cause of this royal screw up but I would like to see this show go on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. You're being too hard on yourself. We had a very truncated rehearsal time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's grab some ice cream, go back to the office, and finish what we started. [others nod in agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what you're saying is you kinda like it? [Phyllis impression] I've fallen and I can't get up! [normal again] That Phyllis bit, that was pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know that we need to dissect it all now, but-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That got a big laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That did. Pretty huge laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Stanley, who is cracking up again] You were laughing right?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I was.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [with Dwight and Michael outside Michael's car] You know what, I have to go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're really close.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I can just run over to the gas station.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We should just wait here and not get good seats in the conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's true, we wouldn't get seats together.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Okay, fine I'll hold it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the car] You know, despite a couple hiccups, I think that went very well.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought it was the worst Dundies I've ever been to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man! Maybe you should have won the Kind of a Bitch Award.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gladly! I'd accept that award, because a bitch, is a female dog!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [as Michael pulls over and stops the car] Please don't stop so suddenly, the seatbelt is pressing on my bladder. Why are you even wearing a seatbelt, you're sitting in the backseat, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is your problem?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just don't see a point in the Dundies! Okay? The jokes are terrible, the venue is bad, the fashion is boring.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! That, that is unfair! The clothing was safe, but tasteful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And next time, why don't you pick a co-host, that doesn't have microphone-a-phobia!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [very uncomfortable] Look, what ever you're going to do, how long is it going to take? Ballpark. 'Cause I just, I gotta make a decision here. [gets out and slams the door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He is in an all-out sprint.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in conference room] Here... [Andy walks in] Okay! By his own omission, this person actually tried marijuana in college, so the Doobie Doobie Pothead Stoner of the Year Award goes to, Andy Bernard! [Andy walks up]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A lot of people I'd like to thank, but I think we all actually wanna thank you Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. [nods to him]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, we actually all really wanna thank you, for everything.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [starts playing the tune to Seasons of Love while Andy sits down]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God, something's happening.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! We actually sat down, and did the math.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! That's how many minutes, that you've worked here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: In costumes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And impressions!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: In meetings.

Quote.Speaker: Erin and Kelly
Quote.Text: And cups of coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: For birthdays!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: More meetings and-

Quote.Speaker: Women
Quote.Text: E-Mail forms you made us read.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! That's like watching Die Hard, eighty thousand times!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You hit me with your car!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You helped me get off drugs!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I watch you when you sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I forgive you for kissing me!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Remember to, call. Call. Remember to, call. Call. Remember to, call. Call.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly and Erin
Quote.Text: Call, text or e-mail, or call.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [falsetto] Measure your life in love!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Remember to call, remember to, call. Remember to call.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [choked up] Yeah, okay. [pauses, then takes a deep breath] Well this is gonna hurt like a mother[bleep].

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [recall to Dundies at Louie Volpies] Every day, millions of Americans suffer from extreme repulsiveness. Someone in our midst, is bringing that problem to light. Toby Flenderson, please come up here and accept the Extreme Repulsiveness Award. Oh that's so mean!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Toby is shaking his head, no] It's his last Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gotta play along man.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come on Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here he comes! Alright! You deserve it! [Toby comes up and take the mic]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I really disagree with this. I think it's kind of hateful. Though I am a little happy right now to have a platform to talk about the outcome of a case I was recently a juror on. The Scranton Strangler. That man's being put to death. I was part of the verdict, and I'm not so sure he's guilty any more. [Dwight plays a clip from the song Oh Yeah:
